cards.name: Nantuko Calmer
cards.text:
{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Nantuko Calmer: Destroy target enchantment.
Threshold — Nantuko Calmer gets +1/+1 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Nantuko Calmer: Destroy target enchantment.
Threshold Nantuko Calmer gets +1/+1. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Nantuko Cultivator
cards.text: When Nantuko Cultivator enters the battlefield, you may discard any number of land cards. Put that many +1/+1 counters on Nantuko Cultivator and draw that many cards.
cards.originalText: When Nantuko Cultivator comes into play, you may discard any number of land cards from your hand. Put that many +1/+1 counters on Nantuko Cultivator and draw that many cards.

cards.name: Narcissism
cards.text:
{G}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
{G}, Sacrifice Narcissism: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{G}, Discard a card from your hand: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
{G}, Sacrifice Narcissism: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nostalgic Dreams
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Return X target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Nostalgic Dreams.
cards.flavor: Seton dreams of life renewed.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Nostalgic Dreams, discard X cards from your hand.
Return X target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Remove Nostalgic Dreams from the game.

cards.name: Parallel Evolution
cards.text:
For each creature token on the battlefield, its controller creates a token that's a copy of that creature.
Flashback {4}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
For each creature token in play, its controller puts a creature token into play that's a copy of that creature.
Flashback {4}{G}{G}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Possessed Centaur
cards.text:
Trample
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Possessed Centaur gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature."
cards.originalText:
Trample
Threshold Possessed Centaur gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Seton's Scout
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Threshold — Seton's Scout gets +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Seton's Scout may block as though it had flying.
Threshold Seton's Scout gets +2/+2. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Cabal Coffers
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Add {B} for each Swamp you control.
cards.flavor: Deep within the Cabal's vault, the Mirari pulsed like a dead sun—and its darkness radiated across Otaria.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool for each swamp you control.

cards.name: Tainted Field
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}. Activate this ability only if you control a Swamp.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Play this ability only if you control a swamp.

cards.name: Tainted Isle
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}. Activate this ability only if you control a Swamp.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Play this ability only if you control a swamp.

cards.name: Tainted Peak
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}. Activate this ability only if you control a Swamp.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Play this ability only if you control a swamp.

cards.name: Tainted Wood
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {B} or {G}. Activate this ability only if you control a Swamp.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability only if you control a swamp.

cards.name: Altar of Dementia
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Target player puts a number of cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power from the top of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"It is not that you will go mad. It is that you will beg for madness."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Target player puts a number of cards equal to that creature's power from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Booby Trap
cards.text:
As Booby Trap enters the battlefield, choose an opponent and a card name other than a basic land card name.
The chosen player reveals each card they draw.
When the chosen player draws a card with the chosen name, sacrifice Booby Trap. If you do, Booby Trap deals 10 damage to that player.

rulings.text: The "if you do" part is only done if you successfully sacrifice this card. In other words, it has to be on the battlefield when the trigger resolves or it does not deal damage.
The choice of which card to name is part of the resolution of the spell or ability which puts Booby Trap onto the battlefield. It can't be countered.
If an effect causes the player to draw multiple cards, each card is revealed as it's drawn. If Booby Trap's ability triggers, it will go on the stack once the card-drawing effect has concluded.
If a single Booby Trap's ability triggers multiple times, then only the first ability to resolve causes Booby Trap to be sacrificed and damage to be dealt.
If Booby Trap's last ability is countered, Booby Trap remains on the battlefield (and no damage is dealt).

cards.originalText:
When Booby Trap comes into play, name a card other than a basic land.
Whenever target opponent draws any cards, he or she reveals those cards to all players. If any of those cards is the named card, Sacrifice Booby Trap and it deals 10 damage to that player.

cards.name: Bottle Gnomes
cards.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"I am reminded of the fable of the silver egg. Its owner cracks it open to see what jewels it holds, only to discover a simple yellow yolk."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: Gain 3 life.

cards.name: Coiled Tinviper
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: The bite of the tinviper feels most like a razor drawn across the tongue.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Cold Storage
cards.text:
{3}: Exile target creature you control.
Sacrifice Cold Storage: Return each creature card exiled with Cold Storage to the battlefield under your control.

rulings.text: If this card leaves the battlefield, the cards it exiled remain exiled.
If it exiles a token creature, the token ceases to exist and will not return.

For a time, the second ability returned all cards exiled by it to the battlefield, regardless of what types they had while exiled. It has been restored to its original functionality, so only cards that actually have the type Creature will get returned.

cards.originalText:
{3}: Put target creature you control on Cold Storage.
Sacrifice Cold Storage: Put all creature cards on Cold Storage into play.

cards.name: Cursed Scroll
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Choose a card name, then reveal a card at random from your hand. If that card has the chosen name, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to any target.

rulings.text: If you have no cards in hand, you still have to name a card. Then you fail to reveal one (since there aren't any). Since the named card wasn't revealed, no damage is dealt.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Target opponent chooses a card at random from your hand. If he or she chooses the named card, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Echo Chamber
cards.text: {4}, {T}: An opponent chooses target creature they control. Create a token that's a copy of that creature. That token gains haste until end of turn. Exile the token at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: The token enters the battlefield as the creature it is copying. This triggers its own and any other appropriate enters the battlefield abilities.
The effect only grants Haste until the end of the current turn. If the creature somehow manages to stick around until a later turn, it will no longer have Haste.

cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Target opponent chooses target creature he or she controls. Put a token creature into play and treat it as a copy of that creature. The token creature is unaffected by summoning sickness this turn. At end of turn, remove the token creature from the game. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Emerald Medallion
cards.text: Green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

rulings.text: The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText: Your green spells cost {1} less to play.

cards.name: Emmessi Tome
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: It is like life and destiny: we think we know the story, but we have read only half the tale.
cards.originalText: {5}, {T}: Draw two cards, then choose and discard a card.

cards.name: Energizer
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Energizer.
cards.flavor: Like a kettle set to boil, it must eventually go off—on someone.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Energizer.

cards.name: Essence Bottle
cards.text:
{3}, {T}: Put an elixir counter on Essence Bottle.
{T}, Remove all elixir counters from Essence Bottle: You gain 2 life for each elixir counter removed this way.
cards.originalText:
{3}, {T}: Put an elixir counter on Essence Bottle.
{T}, Remove all elixir counters from Essence Bottle: Gain 2 life for each elixir counter removed in this way.

cards.name: Excavator
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a basic land: Target creature gains landwalk of each of the land types of the sacrificed land until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of any of those types.)

rulings.text: If a land with the supertype "basic" somehow has multiple subtypes, then the creature will gain landwalk of all those types.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a basic land: Target creature gains that landwalk ability until end of turn. (If defending player controls any lands of that type, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Flowstone Sculpture
cards.text: {2}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Flowstone Sculpture or Flowstone Sculpture gains flying, first strike, or trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor: The sculptor, weary of his work, created art that would finish itself.
cards.originalText: {2}, Choose and discard a card: Flowstone Sculpture gains flying, first strike, or trample permanently, or put a +1/+1 counter on Flowstone Sculpture.

cards.name: Fool's Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have no cards in hand.
cards.flavor:
Squee: "What's that?"
Ertai: "It's a magical book."
Squee: "Am I smart enough ta use it?"
Ertai: "You could say that."
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Draw a card. Use this ability only if you have no cards in your hand.

cards.name: Grindstone
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard. If both cards share a color, repeat this process.
cards.flavor:
"Memory is a burden that wears at the soul as weather wears at stone."
—Crovax

rulings.text: If the two cards are both colorless, then the effect does not repeat. It only repeats if both cards have at least one color and at least one color is shared between them.
The effect repeats as many times as it takes to meet the end condition.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Put the top two cards of target player's library into that player's graveyard. If both cards share at least one color, repeat this process.

cards.name: Helm of Possession
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Helm of Possession during your untap step.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Helm of Possession and Helm of Possession remains tapped.
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Helm of Possession during your untap phase.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Gain control of target creature as long as you control Helm of Possession and Helm of Possession remains tapped.

cards.name: Jet Medallion
cards.text: Black spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

rulings.text: The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText: Your black spells cost {1} less to play.

cards.name: Jinxed Idol
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Jinxed Idol deals 2 damage to you.
Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Idol.
cards.flavor: "Here."

rulings.text: Your opponent can use the ability to give this card back to you.

The control-change effect has no duration. The targeted player retains control of Jinxed Idol until the game ends, Jinxed Idol leaves the battlefield, or an effect causes someone else to gain control of it (perhaps because Jinxed Idol's ability is activated again).

If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, Jinxed Idol deals 2 damage to you.
Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Idol permanently.

cards.name: Lotus Petal
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: "Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Magnetic Web
cards.text:
If a creature with a magnet counter on it attacks, all creatures with magnet counters on them attack if able.
Whenever a creature with a magnet counter on it attacks, all creatures with magnet counters on them block that creature this turn if able.
{1}, {T}: Put a magnet counter on target creature.
cards.originalText:
If any creature with any magnet counters on it attacks, all creatures with magnet counters on them that the attacking player controls attack if able.
If any creature with any magnet counters on it attacks, all creatures with magnet counters on them that the defending player controls block that creature if able.
{1}, {T}: Put a magnet counter on target creature.

cards.name: Manakin
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}.
cards.flavor: Hanna regarded Squee sternly. "Because it's not a toy, no matter how much it may look like one," she said, taking the manakin from him.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Metallic Sliver
cards.flavor: When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: Metallic Sliver counts as a Sliver.

cards.name: Mogg Cannon
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Moggs never volunteer for anything twice.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. At end of turn, destroy that creature.

cards.name: Patchwork Gnomes
cards.text: Discard a card: Regenerate Patchwork Gnomes.
cards.flavor:
"Just when I get them working, they always start fighting and tearing at each other for spare parts."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.originalText: Choose and discard a card: Regenerate Patchwork Gnomes.

cards.name: Pearl Medallion
cards.text: White spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

rulings.text: The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText: Your white spells cost {1} less to play.

cards.name: Phyrexian Grimoire
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Target opponent chooses one of the top two cards of your graveyard. Exile that card and put the other one into your hand.
cards.flavor: Every page cost a life; every secret cost a thousand more.

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your graveyard, it is exiled by the first part of the effect and you do not get to put any cards into your hand since the second part fails.
It does not target the cards, but it targets the opponent. If you can't target an opponent, you can't activate this ability.

cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Target opponent chooses one of the top two cards in your graveyard. Remove that card from the game and put the other into your hand.

cards.name: Phyrexian Hulk
cards.flavor:
"They are convenient in having no souls, but less so in having no spirit."
—Volrath

cards.name: Phyrexian Splicer
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Choose flying, first strike, trample, or shadow: Until end of turn, target creature with the chosen ability loses it and another target creature gains it.

rulings.text: If the target which is having the ability removed does not have that ability during the resolution of this effect, then this effect still grants the chosen ability. The reason is that the second target is still legal even if the first one is not.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Choose flying, first strike, trample, or shadow. Target creature with that ability loses it until end of turn. Another target creature gains that ability until end of turn.

cards.name: Puppet Strings
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
cards.flavor: "Have no illusions," Volrath warned Greven, "about free will."
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Tap or untap target creature.

cards.name: Ruby Medallion
cards.text: Red spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

rulings.text: The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText: Your red spells cost {1} less to play.

cards.name: Sapphire Medallion
cards.text: Blue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

rulings.text: The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText: Your blue spells cost {1} less to play.

cards.name: Scalding Tongs
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have three or fewer cards in hand, Scalding Tongs deals 1 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
cards.flavor:
"This has nothing to do with what you know and everything to do with what I wish."
—Volrath

rulings.text: You target one opposing player each time the ability triggers.

It checks the number of cards in your hand at the beginning of upkeep and does not trigger at all if you have more than three. It checks again on resolution and does not deal damage unless you still have 3 or fewer cards.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep, if you have three or fewer cards in your hand, Scalding Tongs deals 1 damage to target opponent.

cards.name: Scroll Rack
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Exile any number of cards from your hand face down. Put that many cards from the top of your library into your hand. Then look at the exiled cards and put them on top of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If there are not enough cards in the library, you do not lose. This is not a draw effect. You just get as many cards as are there, even if there are zero cards in the library.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Choose any number of cards in your hand and set those cards aside. Put an equal number of cards from the top of your library into your hand. Then put the cards set aside in this way on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Squee's Toy
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: As the horrors closed in on Gerrard, Squee trembled and clutched his toy for comfort. He didn't know where it came from or why it was so warm, but he was glad he'd kept it near.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent 1 damage to any creature.

cards.name: Static Orb
cards.text: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.
cards.flavor:
Time passes, time crawls;
Time doesn't move at all.

rulings.text: If there are two of these on the battlefield, they do not add together. The result is that only two permanents can be untapped.

cards.originalText: Players cannot untap more than two permanents during their untap phases.

cards.name: Telethopter
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Telethopter gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: After losing several of the devices to midair collisions, Greven forbade moggs from operating telethopters.
cards.originalText: Tap a creature you control: Telethopter gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Thumbscrews
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have five or more cards in hand, Thumbscrews deals 1 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
cards.flavor:
"We will start small, I think."
—Volrath

rulings.text: It checks the number of cards in your hand at the beginning of upkeep, and if you have 4 or fewer cards in hand it will not trigger. It checks again when it resolves and will not deal damage unless you still have 5 or more cards in hand.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep, if you have five or more cards in your hand, Thumbscrews deals 1 damage to target opponent.

cards.name: Torture Chamber
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a pain counter on Torture Chamber.
At the beginning of your end step, Torture Chamber deals damage to you equal to the number of pain counters on it.
{1}, {T}, Remove all pain counters from Torture Chamber: Torture Chamber deals damage to target creature equal to the number of pain counters removed this way.
cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, put a pain counter on Torture Chamber.
At the end of your turn, Torture Chamber deals 1 damage to you for each pain counter on it.
{1}, {T}, Remove all pain counters from Torture Chamber: Torture Chamber deals 1 damage for each pain counter on it to target creature.

cards.name: Watchdog
cards.text:
Watchdog blocks each combat if able.
As long as Watchdog is untapped, all creatures attacking you get -1/-0.
cards.flavor: Its growl is a long, rumbling grind of gears and clockwork, its bark a blast of hissing steam.

rulings.text: The second ability is no longer triggered. It continuously checks the tapped/untapped status of the Watchdog, and gives them -1/-0 as appropriate.

cards.originalText:
Watchdog blocks if able.
As long as Watchdog is untapped, all creatures attacking you get -1/-0.

cards.name: Abandon Hope
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Look at target opponent's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
cards.flavor: As Gerrard's form vanished into the maw of trees, Hanna mouthed a silent plea, mourning a crushed dream.
cards.originalText: Choose and discard X cards: Look at target opponent's hand and choose X of those cards. That player discards the chosen cards.

cards.name: Ancient Tomb
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}. Ancient Tomb deals 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
There is no glory to be gained in the kingdom of the dead.
—Vec tomb inscription
cards.originalText: {T}: Add two colorless mana to your mana pool. Ancient Tomb deals 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Bellowing Fiend
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Bellowing Fiend deals damage to a creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Bellowing Fiend damages any creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Bounty Hunter
cards.text:
{T}: Put a bounty counter on target nonblack creature.
{T}: Destroy target creature with a bounty counter on it.
cards.flavor: "Once they've marked you," Starke said, "the world is made of glass."
cards.originalText:
{T}: Put a bounty counter on target nonblack creature.
{T}: Destroy target creature with any bounty counters on it.

cards.name: Carrionette
cards.text: {2}{B}{B}: Exile Carrionette and target creature unless that creature's controller pays {2}. Activate this ability only if Carrionette is in your graveyard.

rulings.text: Since it is exiled as part of the effect and not part of the cost, you can activate its ability more than once.
A creature with Protection from Creatures can't be targeted by this card's ability.

cards.originalText: {2}{B}{B}: Remove Carrionette and target creature from the game. That creature's controller may pay {2} to counter this ability. Use this ability only if Carrionette is in your graveyard.

cards.name: Clot Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor:
"One would think I would be accustomed to unexpected returns."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: Each Sliver gains "{2}: Regenerate this creature."

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"There's very little that escapes me, Greven. And you will escape very little if you fail."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Look at target opponent's hand and choose one of those cards. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Coffin Queen
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.

rulings.text: If the creature put onto the battlefield leaves the battlefield, the tracking effect ends and the creature will no longer be exiled if something happens to the Coffin Queen.

If the creature put onto the battlefield phases out, the tracking effect continues when it phases back in if the Coffin Queen is still on the battlefield. If the Queen left the battlefield while the creature was phased out, the creature phases in as normal.

If Coffin Queen leaves the battlefield before its ability resolves, the delayed trigger condition can never be fulfilled, so the creature will not be exiled. If Coffin Queen is untapped when its ability resolves, the creature will not be exiled until the next time Coffin Queen becomes untapped.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap phase.
{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from any graveyard into play under your control. Remove that creature from the game if Coffin Queen becomes untapped or if you lose control of Coffin Queen.

cards.name: Commander Greven il-Vec
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Commander Greven il-Vec enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
cards.flavor:
"Rage is the only freedom left me."
—Greven il-Vec
cards.originalText:
When Commander Greven il-Vec comes into play, sacrifice a creature.
Greven cannot be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.

cards.name: Corpse Dance
cards.text:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: Corpse Dance only exiles the card if the card is still on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step.
The effect only grants Haste until the end of the current turn. If the creature somehow manages to stick around until a later turn, it will no longer have Haste.

cards.originalText:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Put the top creature card from your graveyard into play. That creature is unaffected by summoning sickness this turn. Remove the creature from the game at end of turn.

cards.name: Dark Banishing
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"It is the way of most wizards to begin by exiling themselves and to end by exiling everyone else."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. That creature cannot be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.flavor:
"If there is such a thing as too much power, I have not discovered it."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Darkling Stalker
cards.text:
{B}: Regenerate Darkling Stalker.
{B}: Darkling Stalker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"In this dark place, yes, I am afraid of my own shadow."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText:
{B}: Regenerate Darkling Stalker.
{B}: Darkling Stalker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dauthi Embrace
cards.text: {B}{B}: Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor:
"The Dauthi army grows by screams and bounds."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary
cards.originalText: {B}{B}: Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.name: Dauthi Ghoul
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever a creature with shadow dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Dauthi Ghoul.
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever any creature with shadow is put into any graveyard from play, put a +1/+1 counter on Dauthi Ghoul.

cards.name: Dauthi Horror
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Horror can't be blocked by white creatures.
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Horror cannot be blocked by white creatures.

cards.name: Dauthi Marauder
cards.text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor:
"The Dauthi came from beneath the Ruins one night, and the darkness cast them in the best possible light."
—Soltari Tales of Life
cards.originalText: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.name: Dauthi Mercenary
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}: Dauthi Mercenary gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Dauthi believe they dignify murder by paying for it."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}: Dauthi Mercenary gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dauthi Mindripper
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Dauthi Mindripper attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Sacrifice Dauthi Mindripper: Defending player chooses and discards three cards. Use this ability only if Dauthi Mindripper is attacking and unblocked.

cards.name: Dauthi Slayer
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Slayer attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor:
"They have knives for every soul."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Each turn, Dauthi Slayer attacks if able.

cards.name: Death Pits of Rath
cards.text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: As the sludge below began to shift and take shapes, Gerrard turned from the railing to Orim. "I suppose," he said, "it's a little too late for prayer, isn't it?"
cards.originalText: Whenever any creature is dealt damage, destroy it. That creature cannot be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Diabolic Edict
cards.text: Target player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."
cards.originalText: Target player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Disturbed Burial
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Dread of Night
cards.text: White creatures get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel
cards.originalText: All white creatures get -1/-1.

cards.name: Dregs of Sorrow
cards.text: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.
cards.flavor: Crovax gazed upon the dead, and for one dark moment he saw a banquet.

rulings.text: X can be zero.

cards.originalText: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.

cards.name: Endless Scream
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Endless Scream enters the battlefield with X scream counters on it.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each scream counter on Endless Scream.
cards.flavor:
"I have made Crovax weep; now I will make him scream. The pain will not end, but will bind him to me."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +X/+0.

cards.name: Enfeeblement
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
cards.flavor: Crovax had witnessed Selenia lead the Predator to the Weatherlight. As the battle raged on deck, he felt his strength melt in the heat of her betrayal.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

cards.name: Evincar's Justice
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Evincar's Justice deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Evincar's Justice deals 2 damage to each creature and player.

cards.name: Extinction
cards.text: Destroy all creatures of the creature type of your choice.
cards.flavor:
"I once had an entire race killed just to listen to the rattling of their dried bones as I waded through them."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures of any creature type of your choice.

cards.name: Fevered Convulsions
cards.text: {2}{B}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Tell me again why you failed to capture Gerrard, you worthless pile of spine."
—Volrath, to Greven
cards.originalText: {2}{B}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Imps' Taunt
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature attacks this turn if able.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Target creature attacks this turn if able.

cards.name: Kezzerdrix
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, if your opponents control no creatures, Kezzerdrix deals 4 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
First strike
During your upkeep, if your opponents control no creatures, Kezzerdrix deals 4 damage to you.

cards.name: Knight of Dusk
cards.text: {B}{B}: Destroy target creature blocking Knight of Dusk.
cards.flavor:
Fall like night upon the foe.
—Motto of the Knights of Dusk
cards.originalText: {B}{B}: Destroy target creature blocking Knight of Dusk.

cards.name: Leeching Licid
cards.text:
{B}, {T}: Leeching Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {B} to end this effect.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Leeching Licid deals 1 damage to that player.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

cards.originalText: {B}, {T}: Leeching Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "During the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Leeching Licid deals 1 damage to that player" instead of a creature. Move Leeching Licid onto target creature. You may pay {B} to end this effect.

cards.name: Living Death
cards.text: Each player exiles all creature cards from their graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures they control, then puts all cards they exiled this way onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: As Living Death resolves, all players exile their creature cards from graveyards at the same time. Then all players sacrifice all creatures they control at the same time. Then all players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield at the same time.

Only cards exiled by Living Death's first instruction are put onto the battlefield. If a replacement effect (such as that of Leyline of the Void) causes any of the sacrificed creatures to be exiled instead of put into a graveyard, those cards aren't returned to the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Set aside all creature cards in all graveyards. Then, put each creature that is in play into its owner's graveyard. Then, put each creature card set aside in this way into play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Maddening Imp
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Non-Wall creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able. At the beginning of the next end step, destroy each of those creatures that didn't attack this turn. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn and only before combat.

rulings.text: If a creature can't attack because of some restriction, or because it is tapped, it is destroyed at the end of the turn.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: All non-Wall creatures target opponent controls attack this turn if able. At end of turn, destroy each of those creatures that did not attack. Use this ability only during target opponent's turn and only before combat.

cards.name: Marsh Lurker
cards.text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Marsh Lurker gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: From the mists it rises, into the mists it retreats; through the mists it walks, fearless and unseen.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a swamp: Marsh Lurker cannot be blocked this turn except by artifact creatures and black creatures.

cards.name: Mindwhip Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Target player discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery."
cards.flavor:
"They share more than their thoughts. We must shatter their link quickly!"
—Hanna, to Orim

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

If you cast a Sliver as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: Each Sliver gains "{2}, Sacrifice this creature: Target player discards a card at random. Play this ability as a sorcery."

cards.name: Minion of the Wastes
cards.text:
Trample
As Minion of the Wastes enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life.
Minion of the Wastes's power and toughness are each equal to the life paid as it entered the battlefield.

rulings.text: The life is paid as Minion of the Wastes enters the battlefield. If Minion of the Wastes is countered, you don't get the opportunity to pay any life.

cards.originalText:
Trample
When you play Minion of the Wastes, pay any amount of life.
Minion of the Wastes has power and toughness each equal to that amount.

cards.name: Perish
cards.text: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: Destroy all green creatures. Those creatures cannot be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Pit Imp
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Pit Imp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
cards.flavor: The moans of the Death Pits were underscored by the chattering of imps, for whom the ship was cause for much discussion.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: Pit Imp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {B}{B} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Rain of Tears
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"These rains cannot quench; they carve the land's face like a scalpel on flesh."
—Crovax
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Rats of Rath
cards.text: {B}: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land you control.
cards.flavor:
"These creatures offer new challenges in the scrutiny of entrails."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: {B}: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land you control.

cards.name: Reanimate
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"You will learn to earn death."
—Volrath

rulings.text: You lose life equal to the converted mana cost of the card you're bringing back, so if you Reanimate Volrath's Shapeshifter, you lose three life, regardless of what the next card down is.

cards.originalText: Put target creature card from any graveyard into play under your control. Lose life equal to that creature's total casting cost.

cards.name: Reckless Spite
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
cards.flavor:
"My plan's elegance leads my enemies to believe it is spite that fuels me."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. Lose 5 life.

cards.name: Sadistic Glee
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"First blood isn't as important as last blood."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Whenever any creature is put into any graveyard from play, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.

cards.name: Sarcomancy
cards.text:
When Sarcomancy enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Zombies on the battlefield, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
When Sarcomancy comes into play, put a Zombie token into play. Treat this token as a 2/2 black creature.
During your upkeep, if there are no Zombies in play, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Screeching Harpy
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{B}: Regenerate Screeching Harpy.
cards.flavor:
"They are called 'fowl' for a reason."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

{1}{B}: Regenerate Screeching Harpy.
